thinking.disposable_income: Edgebrook has a median household income of around $45,000, which is lower than Houston's average, indicating residents are price-sensitive to transportation costs.
thinking.discretionary_consumption: With modest income levels and significant portion going to basic needs, residents have limited discretionary spending capacity and are sensitive to both sales tax increases and transportation fees.
thinking.accessibility: The neighborhood has moderate transit access with some bus routes but is largely car-dependent, with about 90% of residents commuting by car.
thinking.decision_rationale: 1) Prioritized policies with lower sales tax (0.5%) to minimize impact on household budgets. 2) Favored moderate driving fees ($0.50) over high fees ($1.00) given car dependency. 3) Preferred lower transit fares ($0.75-$1.25) to make transit more accessible. 4) Balanced travel time improvements with cost burden. 5) Selected proposals that provide reasonable transit improvements without excessive financial burden on driving-dependent residents.
